intro: Reseda alba var. hexapetala, commonly known as the six-petaled white reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important plants. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
